title.narrative: Southern Africa Aircraft & Airport Development Study

description.narrative: All official reports from major aircraft manufacturers and the Southern African Development Community (Multi-Annual Strategic Plan) show a big increase in demand of aircrafts in the (Southern) African countries. An increase in passengers and cargo movements means a need for efficient infrastructure (airports) and aircraft maintenance. Furthermore, government support will be relevant for creating a network through Government-to-Government relations. Airport development within countries, typically has a very strong government involvement.The SADC region is considered as a potentially interesting region for future cooperation opportunities in Maintenance Repair and Overhaul (MRO) and airport development & infrastructure. However, the knowledge on the region is limited. Therefore, the request for a report on developments within aircraft maintenance and airport development & infrastructure. The report should give an insight in short- and long-term opportunities (airport development) within the aerospace industry. Furthermore, there is a need within the Dutch industry to have an understanding about the main stakeholders regarding decision making, financing and partnerships. The Netherlands Aerospace Group (NAG) is the trade association for aerospace in the Netherlands. Their 100+ members cluster over 95% of the aircraft manufacturing, aircraft maintenance and airport development and infrastructure industry in the Netherlands. The NAG is a non-profit organisation founded in 1976 and supports its members through knowledge, international positioning and representation towards the (national) government. The NAG has been commissioned to carry out a fact finding study about the aerospace sector in Southern Africa.
